title: 110_s580
content: Revision of feasibility and suitability studies of existing national historic trails. The National Trails System Act is amended to include the revision of feasibility and suitability studies for existing national historic trails, considering possible additions to the trails. The revision includes definitions for terms like "route" and "shared route." The National Trails System Act is amended to include a study requirement for the Oregon National Historic Trail routes, to be completed and submitted to Congress within three fiscal years. The National Trails System Act is amended to include a study of various routes of the Oregon Trail from 1830-1870 to determine their feasibility as components of the Oregon National Historic Trail. Routes to be studied include Whitman Mission, Upper Columbia River, Cowlitz River, Meek cutoff, Free Emigrant Road, North Alternate Oregon Trail, Goodale's cutoff, North Side alternate route, and Cutoff to Barlow road. The Secretary of the Interior will study the southern alternative route of the Pony Express Trail and other routes to determine their suitability for the Pony Express National Historic Trail. Additionally, a study will be conducted on various routes of the California Trail to assess their feasibility for inclusion in the California National Historic Trail. The Secretary of the Interior will study various routes, including Missouri Valley routes like Blue Mills-Independence Road and Westport Landing Road, to determine their feasibility for designation as components of the California National Historic Trail. The Secretary of the Interior will study various routes for designation as components of the California National Historic Trail, including Westport-Lawrence Road, Fort Leavenworth-Blue River route, Road to Amazonia, Union Ferry Route, Old Wyoming-Nebraska City cutoff, Lower Plattsmouth Route, Lower Bellevue Route, Woodbury cutoff, Blue Ridge cutoff, Westport Road, Gum Springs-Fort Leavenworth route, and Atchison/Independence Creek routes. The Secretary of the Interior is studying various routes for designation as components of the California National Historic Trail, including Fort Leavenworth-Kansas River route, Nebraska City cutoff routes, Minersville-Nebraska City Road, Upper Plattsmouth route, Upper Bellevue route, Cherokee Trail, Weber Canyon route of Hastings cutoff, Bishop Creek cutoff, McAuley cutoff, and Diamond Springs cutoff. The Secretary of the Interior is studying various routes for designation as components of the California National Historic Trail, including Fort Leavenworth-Kansas River route, Nebraska City cutoff routes, Minersville-Nebraska City Road, Upper Plattsmouth route, Upper Bellevue route, Cherokee Trail, Weber Canyon route of Hastings cutoff, Bishop Creek cutoff, McAuley cutoff, and Diamond Springs cutoff. Western routes include Bidwell-Bartleson route, Georgetown/Dagget Pass Trail, Big Trees Road, Grizzly Flat cutoff, Nevada City Road, Yreka Trail, Henness Pass route, Johnson cutoff, Luther Pass Trail, and Volcano Road. The Secretary of the Interior is conducting a study on various routes for potential designation as components of the California National Historic Trail, including Volcano Road, Sacramento-Coloma Wagon Road, Burnett cutoff, and Placer County Road to Auburn. Additionally, a study is required for the Mormon Pioneer National Historic Trail to determine the feasibility and suitability of designation for specific routes. The study will assess the feasibility and suitability of designating several routes as components of the Mormon Pioneer National Historic Trail, including 1846 Subsequent routes A and B, 1856-57 Handcart route, Keokuk route, 1847 Alternative Elkhorn and Loup River Crossings, and Fort Leavenworth Road. The Secretary of the Interior will study shared routes of the California Trail and Oregon Trail to determine their feasibility as components of the California National Historic Trail and the Oregon National Historic Trail. The Secretary of the Interior will study routes including St. Joe Road, Council Bluffs Road, Sublette cutoff, Applegate route, Old Fort Kearny Road, Childs cutoff, and Raft River to Applegate for the California and Oregon National Historic Trails.
